Class ContactHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ContactHandler
  • public class ContactHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    ContactHandler class has the methods for writing, reading, deleting and updating contacts. Shortly all the file handling is done in this class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ContactHandler()
      The constructer of the ContactHandler Constructor only sets the format for how the data will be saved.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void create​(Person p)
      The create method creates a new contact to the file.
      void createContactsFile()
      creteContactsFile of the ContactHandler class The method creates the data file where the contacts are stored if it does not exist yet.
      void delete​(java.lang.String id)
      The delete method of ContactHandler deletes contacts by the given ID Delete method reads the contact file to an arrayList, and then removes the line/contact that contains the id.
      java.lang.String getFormat​(formatEnum whatToFormat)
      GetFormat method returns the correct formats for the contact info.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> read()
      The read method of the contacthandler class, reads the whole txt file.
      void setFormat()
      The setFormat method sets the "key" format for saving contact info
      void update​(java.lang.String id, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> infoMap)
      The update method of the ContactHandler class is used update a contact.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContactHandler

        public ContactHandler()
        The constructer of the ContactHandler Constructor only sets the format for how the data will be saved. Also creates the data file for contacts if it doesn't exist

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public void create​(Person p)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        The create method creates a new contact to the file. Create method maps the user's entered info to a hashmap and after that, writes the key value pairs to the txt file using fileWriter.
        Parameters:
        p - person object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • read

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> read()
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        The read method of the contacthandler class, reads the whole txt file. Read method read the contacts file to an arraylist using bufferedreader and then returns the arraylist. Does not actually display info.
        Returns:
        infoList
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • update

        public void update​(java.lang.String id,
                   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> infoMap)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        The update method of the ContactHandler class is used update a contact. Update method finds the contact to update by the given id, and then updates the values the user wants to update. It'd done by merging old and new values, making a new person object.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the person to updata
        infoMap - the hashmap of the updatable info.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • delete

        public void delete​(java.lang.String id)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        The delete method of ContactHandler deletes contacts by the given ID Delete method reads the contact file to an arrayList, and then removes the line/contact that contains the id. Overwrites the contact file with content of the arraylist without the removed contact.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the removable contact
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setFormat

        public void setFormat()
        The setFormat method sets the "key" format for saving contact info

      • createContactsFile

        public void createContactsFile()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        creteContactsFile of the ContactHandler class The method creates the data file where the contacts are stored if it does not exist yet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getFormat

        public java.lang.String getFormat​(formatEnum whatToFormat)
        GetFormat method returns the correct formats for the contact info.
        Parameters:
        whatToFormat - info that needs formatting.
        Returns:
        format "key" for the info.
